Title: Data Analyst III - eComm Marketing Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for the deploying the SEO strategy of Walmart. com in the US, orchestrating the organic growth of natural search, while cohesively optimizing SEO across all departments. Our future Senior Data Analyst will serve as the point-person for SEO-related initiatives including SEO strategy, managing partnerships with key Search Partners (SEO Support agencies etc.), being a Subject Matter Expert for Local Search /Product/Engineering on SEO execution, ensuring consistent company-wide SEO best practices, and overseeing SEO analytics & reporting. The vast majority of SEO at Walmart.com is in-house and fast paced, those who truly understand the work at hand will excel in this position.

The perfect candidate will have a true passion for SEO and thrive on fast paced, high growth environment. Orchestrate high-volume, organic search growth for Walmart. com Find, evaluate, and capitalize upon SEO expansion opportunities at all levels must be able to see things others don't, and successfully drive growth. Provide Top-level SEO Analytics & business reporting, including site-wide analytics & reporting, Business unit reporting, and Whole-business SEO strategy.

Support total customer journey within each business unit including decision-point advising, granular category support, persona-centric keyword mapping, Category keyword mapping, campaign keyword mapping, competitive metrics & strategy, and granular owned & Marketplace item SEO Support whole-site by page-type, optimize at Scale (process-driven), page type product improvements (with Labs), assortment page-type SEO, and owned item & Marketplace page-type SEO Identify best practices for maximizing search success and mitigating risk Evaluate search demand to identify growth opportunities for our content and product

Conduct cohesive analysis to predict topics relevant to our demographics Liaise with US & global business partners on SEO-related initiatives Maintain a high level of new & existing product understanding to ensure search success Constitute the point-person for technical SEO queries from the team Monitor keyword ranking performance Identify, analyze, and capitalize upon incremental traffic opportunities Provide actionable recommendations for site structure, creative design, keyword and link development strategies, and content optimization.



Strong preference for a data-driven marketing approach Superior knowledge of SEO best practices regarding keyword research, on-page optimization, link building Well-honed Relationship Building Skills Proven ability to manage high-performance people.

About Store N°8

We are the incubation arm of Walmart. Store N°8 was formed in 2017 as part of Walmart's larger innovation mission to shape the future of commerce. We pursue big ideas and take risks by stepping outside of Walmart's core business to focus on leapfrog capabilities across conversational commerce, mixed reality, in-store digitization, and more. Our ultimate goal: fuel Walmart's core business, create new operational efficiencies, and unlock amazing experiences for our customers in the long-term.

This team within Store N°8 is working on healthcare innovations because Walmart's promise is to help its customers save money and live better . This includes building products that enhance both their physical and emotional wellbeing.



As a Health Data Analyst for one of our Store N°8's portfolio companies, your focus will be analysis and processing of large healthcare claims and clinical data sets from both inpatient and outpatient settings. Reporting directly to the Head of Informatics and Clinical Strategy, you will partner with our data engineering, data science, and product teams. You will need to be a self-starter with bias for action and excellent communication skills.

This is a rare opportunity, moving at the speed of a startup, with the backing and in house data (lots of data) of the Fortune 1 company. You will bridge the art of what's possible across today's rapidly evolving healthcare data and informatics landscape. You'll also get the opportunity for rapid career growth through mentorship and training by top data scientists.

Title: Data Analyst III - eComm Marketing Operations Analyst
Job_Description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Introduction:

Walmart is hiring for an exciting new opportunity to be a part of the Transportation Modeling Center of Excellence. Candidates in this high-visibility role will use advanced analytics (modeling, data visualization, simulation) to help leaders make data-driven decisions to help reduce transportation costs and improve service.

You'll sweep us off our feet if you...
Bring 2-5 years of transportation modeling experience



Providing decision support and expertise to decision-makers in Walmart Transportation.


Build and maintain transportation models from the ground up. You'll work with various teams across Walmart to collect data, build models, analyze the output, and make recommendations to leadership based on the data.



2-5 years of transportation modeling experience

Advanced knowledge of Python, SQL, Tableau & PowerBI



Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.



What started small, with a single discount store and the simple idea of selling more for less, has grown over the last 50 years into the largest retailer in the world. Each week, over 260 million customers and members visit our 11,695 stores under 59 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce websites in 11 countries. With fiscal year 2017 revenue of $485.9 billion, Walmart employs approximately 2.3 million associates worldwide. Walmart continues to be a leader in sustainability, corporate philanthropy and employment opportunity. It's all part of our unwavering commitment to creating opportunities and bringing value to customers and communities around the world.



Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their face. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of 15,000+ software engineers, data scientists and service professionals within Walmart, the world's largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2.2 million associates. To others, innovation looks like an app, service or some code, but Walmart has always been about people. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. Being human-led is our true disruption.



Working virtually this year has helped us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team, be more flexible in our personal lives and spend less time commuting. Today, we are reimagining the tech workplace of the future by making a permanent transition to virtual work for most of our team. Of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. We'll collaborate in person at a regular cadence and with purpose.
